answers.answer: These lab results are concerning, and I suggest seeing a physician immediately to discuss them.The sodium level is markedly elevated, due to water depletion or dehydration.  This needs to be addressed.An elevated A1C is suggestive of diabetes and needs to be discussed.C-reactive protein is indicative of inflammation - due to infection or rheumatological disease for instance.  By itself it is non-specific and should be taken in context with the clinical picture.Regarding the lipid panel - the triglycerides are high and HDL (good cholesterol) is low.  This is a fairly common picture, and can be addressed first with lifestyle changes.These lab results needs to be discussed with your physician ASAP.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patients education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com

I took myself off of ALL medications 11/26/07for 1 1/2 years I slept 1-2 hours at a time because I wake up hurting,pain meds let me sleep 3-4 hours. I found a ND a few days after stopping all meds and he suggested I do 12 treatments of colonics to detox, drink georges aloe, take coral legend and fish oil. I just had my third colonics and backis better. no joint pains and sleeping 7-8 hours.My concern is... the ND wouldnt know if there was something more serius with the blood test.
unfortunately both blood work was discussed with my prior dr and I was told not to worry about it , I have an appt with a new dr jan 7th
how'd it go with your new doc today?
